00035 /*******************************************************************************
00036     MACROS
00037 *******************************************************************************/
00038 /*
00039 \brief 'OGT_FB_USE_PIXEL_BUFFER_OBJECTS' - #define'ing OGT_FB_USE_PIXEL_BUFFER_OBJECTS
00040 enables faster implementation of the Framebuffer class.  This implementation
00041 requires OpenGL 2.1 support on the graphics card.  If OGT_FB_USE_PIXEL_BUFFER_OBJECTS
00042 is not #define'd, then a less efficient implementaiton of the Framebuffer class
00043 is compiled that is compatible with earlier versions of OpenGL.
00044 
00045 Framebuffer::init will abort if code was compiled with incompatible settings.
00046 Then you would comment out this #define and recompile.
00047 */
00048 //#define OGT_FB_USE_PIXEL_BUFFER_OBJECTS
00049 
00050 /*
00051 \brief If 'FBT4_DO_BOUNDS_CHECKING' is define'd all Framebuffer member functions 
00052 that access the framebuffer's pixels will check that the specified target pixel 
00053 coordinates are inside the bounds of the framebuffer.  
00054 
00055 Note, 'FBT4_DO_BOUNDS_CHECKING' should generally be left undefine'd when during optimized 
00056 compiling; hence under non-debug compilation it is disabled by default.
00057 */
00058 #ifndef NDEBUG
00059 #define FBT4_DO_BOUNDS_CHECKING
00060 #endif
00061

00224 
00225     /* 'width_' is the width of this Framebuffer */
00226     int width_;
00227     /* 'height_' height of this Framebuffer */
00228     int height_;
00229     /* 'mode_' is the current pixel writing Mode for this Framebuffer (see Mode) */
00230     Mode mode_; 
00231 
00232     /* 'locked_' is this Framebuffer locked */
00233     bool locked_;
00234 
00235     /* 'lockCount' is used for nested calls to lock */
00236     int lockCount;
00237 
00238     /* 'pixelBuffer' is the OGL handle to the created PBO */
00239     GLuint pixelBuffer;
00240 
00241     /* 'pixels' is glMapBuffer'ed to the Pixel Buffer Object */
00242     GLubyte* pixels;
00243 
00245    #ifdef OGT_FB_USE_PIXEL_BUFFER_OBJECTS    
00246     enum {ALIGNMENT=1,COMPONENTS=3,FORMAT=GL_RGB};   
00247     /* these settings below were me testing for optimization for Nvidia hardware (see [R1]) 
00248        since I'm not seeing significant performance improvement with PBOs :(
00249      */
00250     //enum {ALIGNMENT=1,COMPONENTS=3,FORMAT=GL_RGB};

00252    #else

00254    #endif
